title: Joe Cole and Jermaine Jenas slam Tottenham Hotspur after 3-0 Brighton humiliation
text:
Joe Cole and Jermaine Jenas slammed Tottenham Hotspur after yet another abject performance on Saturday left them suffering a humiliating 3-0 defeat by Brighton.

Spurs were looking for a response from their 7-2 loss at home to Bayern Munich in the Champions League in midweek but Mauricio Pochettino's troubles continued after an Aaron Connolly double downed the north London side.

And former England international Cole led the criticism for Pochettino's men after their defeat at the Amex Stadium.

Joe Cole slammed Spurs for another abject performance in their 3-0 defeat at Brighton

Jermaine Jenas said his former club need to freshen things up after constant uncertainty

'The club is in disarray,' he said on BT Sport. 'We're going to credit Brighton but today Tottenham was dreadful.

'No desire, no heart there was no press, tactically they looked inept. Pochettino looked uninterested on the bench.

'I think it's getting to the point where it's the end of the road for this team and this manager but it's going to be difficult because he's an asset to the club it's not like a normal situation you can let him go and get someone in.

'These players aren't bad players. But as a group it's fallen apart and I think we're at the point where something has to change.'

The north London side suffered a humiliating 3-0 defeat to Brighton and Hove Albion

Jermaine Jenas said his former club needs to freshen things up, with several key players' uncertain futures dragging Spurs down. Christian Eriksen, Jan Vertonghen and Toby Alderweireld have all been linked with moves away in the summer but none of those outgoings came to fruition, leaving their Spurs careers in limbo.

He said: 'I love Mauricio and really hope he stays but it stinks of that type of moment things seem really stale. He's been at the club for a number of years.

'I feel the club have let Mauricio down and the players are not applying themselves. Something needs to change hopefully it's the players' mentality and not the manager.'

The latest defeat raises questions over Pochettino's future in north London, with several key decisions needing to be made by chairman Daniel Levy to lift Spurs out of the rut currently surrounding the club.
